item.title: Afghanistan war: At least 27 children killed in three days, UN says
item.description: Unicef says 27 deaths were recorded in three regions over 72 hours, amid rising violence.

item.title: Why China's climate policy matters to us all
item.description: The global battle against climate change is likely to be won or lost in China.

item.title: Alibaba to sack manager accused of rape, according to memo seen by BBC
item.description: The move comes after a woman's allegations of sexual assault went viral on Chinese social media.

item.title: Thailand man charged over death of Swiss tourist near waterfall
item.description: The 27-year-old man has been charged with murdering the 57-year-old woman.

item.title: We For India: Stars unite to help Covid relief work in India
item.description: Ed Sheeran, Annie Lennox, Mick Jagger and Bollywood actors will join forces for livestreamed event.

item.title: Quan Hongchan: Chinese teen diving star's village mobbed by fans
item.description: Quan Hongchan's village has been sealed off after being mobbed by people searching for selfies.

item.title: 'Smallest baby at birth' home after 13 months in hospital
item.description: Kwek Yu Xuan weighed only 212g - the weight of an apple - when she was born in Singapore last year.

item.title: Johnson & Johnson: What we know about India's new Covid vaccines
item.description: India has approved Johnson & Johnson's single-dose vaccine as it ramps up production and procurement.

item.title: Assam-Mizoram clash: 'It was like a war between two countries'
item.description: A long-running border dispute is affecting relations between two neighbouring Indian states.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Taliban capture three regional capitals
item.description: Three cities, including the strategically important Kunduz, fall to the militant group in a single day.

item.title: North Korea: Kim Jong-un calls for relief in flood-hit areas
item.description: More than 1,000 homes have been damaged and about 5,000 people evacuated as a result of flooding.

item.title: Tokyo attack: Knife-wielding man injures 10 on train
item.description: The suspect allegedly told police he was angry when he saw women who "looked happy".

item.title: Larry Page: Google co-founder granted New Zealand residency
item.description: The country's immigration services say he applied under a category for wealthy investors.

item.title: Olympic Games Tokyo 2020: Neeraj Chopra wins historic Olympic gold in athletics
item.description: India has now won seven medals at Tokyo - one gold, two silver and four bronze, its biggest Olympic haul ever.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Olympic athletes struggle with heat at Games
item.description: This games are one of the warmest on record, with many athletes complaining about the high temperatures.

item.title: Covid in Sydney: Communities feel under siege as troops deployed
item.description: Residents say they're being treated like second-class citizens to stem a Covid outbreak.

item.title: India teachersâ€™ fight for period leave gathers steam
item.description: Indian teachers' demand for period leave reignites debate over whether it's a positive step for women.

item.title: China: How Delta threatens a prized zero Covid strategy
item.description: China's battling its widest outbreak since Wuhan - how long can it keep Covid out?

item.title: Article 370: Why more locals in Kashmir are becoming militants
item.description: Two years after India revoked Kashmir's status, more locals are taking up arms in the disputed region.
